intro: Platyptelea, commonly known as the Chinese sandpaper tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. The plants are characterized by their woody stems, palmately lobed leaves, and small, inconspicuous flowers. Platyptelea species are valued for their ornamental leaves and have been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
